reporting_cycle: The Panel of Experts to submit a final report at the end of its mandated period; The Secretary-General to report on updates by 31 October 2002; The Panel of Experts to brief the Chairman of the Committee in October 2002 and provide an oral briefing to the Council in November 2002
summary:
6. Requests States, the Transitional National Government, and local authorities to cooperate fully with the Panel.
Here is a clear and concise summary of the Security Council document:

The Security Council:
- Calls on states, particularly in the region, to provide information on arms embargo violations (para 7).
- Urges individuals and entities to cooperate with the Panel of Experts (para 8).
- Requests the Panel to notify the Council of any lack of cooperation (para 9).
- Requests the Panel to brief the Committee Chairman and provide an oral briefing to the Council (para 10).
- Requests the Panel to submit a final report to the Council through the Committee (para 11).
- Requests the Committee Chairman to forward the report to the Council (para 12).
- Expresses determination to consider the report and proposals for follow-up action (para 13).
- Requests the Secretary-General to include updates on peace-building initiatives, technical assistance, and arms embargo implementation in his next report (para 14).
- Requests the Secretary-General to invite contributions to the UN Trust Fund for Peace-Building in Somalia (para 15).
- Calls on Member States to contribute to UN activities in support of Somalia (para 16).
- Decides to remain actively seized of the matter (para 17).
